intro: Acronychia niueana, commonly known as the Niue hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Niue in the South Pacific. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptical in shape. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found growing in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species of Niue.
